helpgrid.innerhtml: Use this application to view, create and modify service request records. To show My Location on the map, you need to allow the browser to share your location with the server. After the permission is granted, you may need to click the refresh button. Only the records which have the service address defined will be shown on the map.
Note: Please click 'Submit' button from toolbar to submit the ticket. Use of 'Save' button will only partially save, but not submit the ticket.

hyperlink.tooltip: This is not a global issue, Click to change
This is a global issue, Click to change
This is related to a global issue

richtexteditor.label: Describe the scope of this change in technical terms

Business Justification: Indicate whether or not normal processing /availability will be impacted during the change; </br> specify which processes and enviroments are involved and how they will be affected

multilinetextbox.label: Describe the scope of this change in technical terms
Describe the expected outcome in business terms
Describe the potential risk that could result from a failure or problems with this change

helpgrid.innerhtml: Add Persons and Groups to notify about the ticket. Use Other Party to send emails to addresses not defined in SCCD.
Use this application to enter details related to Change record including Change Type, Owner, Ownergroup, Reason for Change etc.

You can apply a solution to the Incident, and set a status as to how this applied solution performed for this ticket. Solutions marked as 'Solution Failed' will be moved to the 'Failed Solutions' table.

table.label: Solutions viewed by self service user

helpgrid.innerhtml: The following tickets are similar to the current ticket. Click Relate Records to relate the selected tickets to the current ticket. Click Cancel to return; your ticket will not be saved.

The View End User Feedback dialog displays end user feedback based survey data submmited by the end user as a result of work in handling or resolving the current service request or incident. The View End User Feedback dialog is a useful resource to quickly understand your customer satisfaction level.
Common requests are predefined templates which populate values for a service request

If the user assigns the ticket to a person, the assigned owner group is the person group this person belongs to. If the user assigns the ticket to a person group, the owner group is that person group.
Indicate if this is a global issue (root cause). Select the root cause if this is not a global issue.
The following are suggested classifications for this ticket. Click Select Classification to choose a classification. Click Cancel to return.
These tables list the Follow Up Records generated from the current ticket.
The following tickets are similar to the current ticket. Click Relate Records to relate the selected tickets to the current ticket. Click Cancel to return; your ticket will not be saved.
The following tickets are similar to the current ticket. Click Relate Records to relate the selected tickets to the current ticket. Click Cancel to return; your ticket will not be saved.

pushbutton.clickmessage: Record(s) have been related to Global Issue.
pushbutton.label: Relate Records to Global Issue

helpgrid.innerhtml: This dialog shows the Estimated Offering Price for this service request.
